candidates.title: Fix `cargo minimal-versions check`
candidates.body:
In a `Cargo.toml`, the dependency versions mean that those versions are the minimum versions required for the project to build.
Sadly, the minimum versions that are given right now will cause compiler errors.

This can be checked through the tool [`cargo-minimal-versions`](https://crates.io/crates/cargo-minimal-versions).

This change modifies the minimal versions so that `cargo minimal-versions check` now succeeds.

candidates.title: Add socket2 feature "all"
candidates.body:
Without this, I see
```rust
error[E0599]: no method named `bind_device` found for struct `Socket` in the current scope
   --> /home/jayvdb/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f/hyper-util-0.1.1/src/client/legacy/connect/http.rs:704:14
    |
703 | /         socket
704 | |             .bind_device(Some(interface.as_bytes()))
    | |             -^^^^^^^^^^^ method not found in `Socket`
    | |_____________|
    | 

error[E0599]: no method named `with_retries` found for struct `TcpKeepalive` in the current scope
   --> /home/jayvdb/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f/hyper-util-0.1.1/src/client/legacy/connect/http.rs:130:12
    |
130 |         ka.with_retries(retries)
    |            ^^^^^^^^^^^^ help: there is a method with a similar name: `with_time`

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0599`.
error: could not compile `hyper-util` (lib) due to 2 previous errors
```

candidates.title: use docsrs --cfg to turn on feature auto cfg
Enable all feature flags when generating docs for docs.rs
candidates.body:
The documentation on docs.rs is empty at the moment, which is not very useful.
This PR enables the `full` feature flag when building docs for docs.rs to make sure all items are documented.

candidates.title: Feature flags: `server-auto` should imply `server`
candidates.body:
As it currently stands, enabling `server-auto` doesn't actually give you access to any new item _unless_ you also enable the `server` feature.
Considering how the code is structured, I think that the `server-auto` feature flag should imply the `server` feature flag.

candidates.title: clean up exposed crate features
candidates.body:
- Put `TokioExecutor` and `TokioIo` into a single `rt::tokio` module.
- The `rt::tokio` module is behind a `tokio` crate feature.
- Changed `auto` crate feature to `server-auto`.
- Added `client-legacy` crate feature, with `client::legacy` behind it.
- Removed `tcp` and `runtime` features, code now depends on the `tokio` feature.

candidates.title: Update dependencies
candidates.body: Updates to 1.0 of hyper, http, and friends.

candidates.title: chore(dependencies): remove once_cell crate version config
candidates.body: The `once_cell` crate version config seems not to be needed now.

candidates.title: fix: replace std::task::ready with futures_util::ready
candidates.body: Replaces `std::task::ready` with `futures_util::ready`, as the former requires Rust 1.64, which is larger than `hyper-util`'s MSRV 1.63.

candidates.title: feat: upgrade to hyper 1.0.0-rc.4, add TokioIo
Unlock once_cell version
candidates.body: In CI MSRV is set to 1.56. It seems lock once_cell to 1.14 is not necessary，and this lock cause conflict with many other crates.

candidates.title: feat(server): add AutoConnection
candidates.body:
Closes hyperium/hyper#2852.

This utility automatically detects HTTP protocol and uses its implementation.

candidates.title: feat(client): `HttpConnector::tcp_keepalive_interval` and `HttpConnec…
candidates.body:
…tor::tcp_keepalive_retries` (#2991)

    If the platform supports setting the options, otherwise it's a noop.

Port from https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/pull/2991

candidates.title: fix: add missing feature flags
candidates.body:
Closes https://github.com/hyperium/hyper-util/issues/7.

This PR:
* adds missing feature flags that were referenced in code, but not in `Cargo.toml`: `runtime`, `tcp`, `http1`, `http2`
* copies `Never` struct from `hyper` and uses it in `client` module to make it compile when features are enabled
* fixes 3 Clippy warnings about preferring `Copy` to `Clone`

There is one test still failing: `client::connect::http::tests::client_happy_eyeballs`. It's a bit over my head, so I didn't attempt to fix it.

candidates.title: feat(pool): import client::pool from hyper
candidates.body:
I'm giving https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/issues/2860 a go, but I'm not sure I'm going in the right direction.

Appreciate if you could take a look when you have time @seanmonstar 

---

Some questions:

Some part of `pool` uses `hyper::Errors`

```log
error[E0624]: associated function `new_canceled` is private
   --> src/client/pool.rs:592:41
    |
592 | ...                   HyperError::new_canceled().with(CheckoutIsClosedError)
    |                                   ^^^^^^^^^^^^ private associated function
    |
   :::
    |
247 |     pub(super) fn new_canceled() -> Error {
    |     ------------------------------------- private associated function defined here
```

I'd imagine that it's probably best to expose these functions from `hyper::Error`, but I'm not sure that this would follow the plan for `hyper-util`?
